title: CV
text:
Teaching
Goethe University Frankfurt
Generative AI in Marketing (co-teach with Bernd Skiera)

Type: MSc-Level, Seminar
Period: Winter 2024/25
This seminar explores the transformative impact of generative AI technologies on marketing. Students will gain an understanding of the underlying AI models and their applications in marketing. We tailor the seminar for students eager to harness the power of AI to drive innovation in marketing, with insights and strategies that can be applied to other business fields as well.

Bachelor and Master Theses Supervision

Period: Summer 2024, Winter 2024/25

title: Research
text:
Resale Royalties in the Creator Economy: Evidence from Non-Fungible Tokens
(joint with Björn Hanneke, Bernd Skiera, and Oliver Hinz)
Sell or Give Away? Economics of Rewarding in the Creator Economy
(joint with Björn Hanneke, Bernd Skiera, and Oliver Hinz)

title: Teaching
text:
Goethe University Frankfurt
Econometrics in Economics (BSc Economics, Tutorial), Winter 2024/25

This course provides an understanding of the fundamental methodologies of modern econometrics with the software R. Topics include probability theory, linear regression, finite sample distribution, asymptotic testing, large sample distribution, instrumental variables, time series analysis, panel data model, and machine learning.

Bachelor and Master Theses Supervision

Topics include machine learning (e.g., XGBoost), blockchains (e.g., crypto tokens), etc.

title: Yu-Jen (Andy) Chuang
text:
I am a Ph.D. candidate in Economics at Goethe University Frankfurt (GSEFM). Currently, I am a research assistant at Chair of Electronic Commerce (Prof. Bernd Skiera) in Department of Marketing.
My research interests extensively focus on digital economics and economics of innovation. I am particularly interested in innovative mechanisms in digital infrastructure (e.g., blockchain, artificial intelligence).
Email: chuang@wiwi.uni-frankfurt.de | yujchuang@gmail.com
